bibl.title: Unlocking the Orphic Doors: Interpretation of Poetry in the Derveni Papyrus between Presocratics and Alexandrians.
Poetry as Initiation. The Center for Hellenistic Studies Symposium on the Derveni Papyrus

bibl.note: Prelude: Reader 1: The Owner of the Derveni Papyrus. - Reader 2: The Author of the Derveni Papyrus and His Diverse Interests. - Column VII: The Selection of Orpheus and ""Enigmatic License"". - Identification / Equivalence as Interpretative Tool. - Interpreter and Text in Pre-Alexandrian Greece. - The Derveni Papyrus as Proto-Commentary. - Appendix: Revisiting the Use of the Paragraphos in P.Derv. X.10-11, XI.8-9, XIII.5-6, XX.10 (especially), and XXIII.7.
bibl.seg: Jeffrey Rusten, Unlocking the Orphic Doors: Interpretation of Poetry in the Derveni Papyrus between Presocratics and Alexandrians.

Ioanna Papadopoulou & Leonard Muellner (edd.), Poetry as Initiation. The Center for Hellenistic Studies Symposium on the Derveni Papyrus = Hellenistic Studies Series. 63 (Cambridge, Mass., 2014) pp. 115-134.

Prelude: Reader 1: The Owner of the Derveni Papyrus. - Reader 2: The Author of the Derveni Papyrus and His Diverse Interests. - Column VII: The Selection of Orpheus and ""Enigmatic License"". - Identification / Equivalence as Interpretative Tool. - Interpreter and Text in Pre-Alexandrian Greece. - The Derveni Papyrus as Proto-Commentary. - Appendix: Revisiting the Use of the Paragraphos in P.Derv. X.10-11, XI.8-9, XIII.5-6, XX.10 (especially), and XXIII.7.
